## DATA GENERATION

bmatrix = function(x, digits = 3) {
    text = "\\begin{bmatrix}\n"
    
    x = as.matrix(x)
    x = round(x, digits = digits)
    for (i in 1:nrow(x)) {
        for (j in 1:ncol(x)) {
            if (is.na(x[i, j])) {
                text = paste0(text, "", " & ")
            } else {
                text = paste0(text, x[i, j], " & ")
                
            }
        }
        text = paste0(text, "\\\\\n")
        
    }
    text = paste0(text, "\\end{bmatrix}")
    return(text)
}



k1<-nn<-3

df <- matrix(round(runif(k1 * 2, 1, 10), 0), nrow = k1) * 2

euclidean <- function(a, b) sqrt(sum((a - b)^2))

dfdf <- matrix(0, nrow = nn, ncol = nn)
dfdf_plt <- matrix(NA, nrow = nn, ncol = nn)

for (i in 1:nn) {
    for (j in 1:nn) {
        dfdf[i, j] <- dfdf_plt[i, j] <- round(euclidean(df[i, ], df[j, ]), 0)
        if (i < j) {
            dfdf_plt[i, j] <- NA
        }
    }
}




cen <- diag(3)-1/3*matrix(1,nrow = 3,ncol = 3)

cencen <- -1/2*cen%*%dfdf%*%cen


sol_round <- round(cencen,2)[2,1]

$$

$$

Provide value of the element from the second row of first column rounded up to 2 digits as the  answer.
